item.title: Covid in Scotland: Young doctors urge peers to get vaccinated
item.description: Medics in their 20s and 30s share their experiences in hospitals in an open letter to young Scots.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Laura Kenny and Katie Archibald win madison gold before Jack Carlin wins sprint bronze
item.description: Laura Kenny and Katie Archibald win Olympic madison gold before Jack Carlin wins sprint bronze.

item.title: Sprats return to the River Clyde in huge numbers
item.description: The return of the fish, a source of food for other species, signals an improvement in the river's ecosystem.

item.title: Boris Johnson faces backlash over Thatcher coal mines comment
item.description: The PM said closing "so many" coal mines gave the UK an "early start" in climate fight.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Director pay and bonus rules for SPFL clubs' loan
item.description: Scottish ministers have put strict conditions on £25.2m worth of emergency Covid loans given to Scottish football clubs.

item.title: RBS report: Hiring activity 'still rising sharply'
item.description: A survey of recruiters suggests Scottish firms continue to expand their workforces as the economy reopens.

item.title: Energy bills to rise by at least £139 for millions of households
item.description: Fuel poverty charities say the price cap increase will come at the worst time during winter.

item.title: New oil development off Shetland should not go ahead - Starmer
item.description: The Labour leader says it would send the wrong signal for the Cambo oil field to be approved ahead of COP26.

item.title: Scotland's papers: PM's coal mines 'joke' and club's 'freedom party'
item.description: Anger over Boris Johnson's comment about mine closures and clubs reopening make the front pages.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Where are the latest cases?
item.description: A daily update on the number and location of coronavirus cases in Scotland.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: How will the rules change on 9 August?

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Your questions answered on life after level zero
item.description: Readers have been sending in their questions about what the ending of more Covid rules means for them.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Do I need a vaccine certificate to travel?

item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: Women's health: I'm in pain but it took years for anyone to listen
item.description: Women tell of lengthy and painful waits for diagnoses ahead of a new government report on women's health.

item.title: COP26: How serious is the government about climate conference?
item.description: With less than 90 days to go to Glasgow climate summit, there is uncertainty surrounding the event.

item.title: Alastair Bruce: 'When I joined the army it was illegal to be gay'
item.description: Maj Gen Alastair Bruce is the highest ranking officer in the British army to have a same-sex wedding.

item.title: Cystic fibrosis drug: 'I feel I've been given a second chance at life'
item.description: A 25-year-old woman says she is now living not just existing, a year after getting a delayed cystic fibrosis drug.

item.title: 'I run my business from my pimped-up camper van'
item.description: Liam Chester was burnt out with work so he converted a camper van to take his office into nature.

item.title: Seasick swimmer makes history by completing Outer Hebrides challenge
item.description: James Armour has become the first person to swim, run and cycle the length of the Outer Hebrides.

item.title: Sir Keir Starmer: 'Shetland oil field should be blocked'

item.title: PM's full interview on visit to Scotland
item.description: Boris Johnson sets out views on the UK working together, the COP26 conference and Scottish drug deaths.

item.title: Most Covid restrictions in Scotland to end from 9 August

item.title: Overflows: ‘There is raw sewage going into the river’
item.description: Data shows that the number of recorded sewage spills in Scotland has increased by 40% over the last five years.

item.title: Humza Yousaf reports nursery over discrimination fears
item.description: Scotland's health secretary says his daughter was twice refused a place at the nursery, which denies any discrimination.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Gold for Katie Archibald, bronze for Jack Carlin & Sarah Robertson

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: GB's Jack Carlin wins bronze in individual sprint

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Great Britain beat India to win women's hockey bronze
